title: Bill's Swordfish Salsa Supreme
summary: Bill's Swordfish Salsa Supreme might be just the Mexican recipe you are searching for. For $15.4 per serving, this recipe covers 45% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This hor d'oeuvre has 1113 calories, 134g of protein, and 59g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 1. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. A mixture of olive oil, chunky salsa, swordfish steaks, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 9 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 78%, this dish is good. Similar recipes include Swordfish with Strawberry Salsa, Grilled Swordfish with Papaya Salsa, and Grilled Swordfish with Papaya Salsa.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Zind-Humbrecht Calcaire Pinot Gris with a 4.7 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 46 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Calcaire Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Bright yellow/gold color, quite luminous. Superb smoky toasty nose, typical for this grape on limestone in Alsace (no new oak in our wines, just very long total lees contact). Some light reductive aromas that actually fit the style of dry Pinot-Gris. The palate is rich and creamy, with a velvety texture yet fully dry. It is an easy wine to drink now as there is no unnecessary weight. The finish is nice and round but fully dry. The complex limestone blend brings great acid balance and a certain weight. It should develop very nicely over the next few years.

instructions: Prepare barbecue-medium high heat.Brush fish with oil.Sprinkle generously with salt and pepper.Grill 4 minutes.Turn over.Spoon salsa over fish.Grill 4 minutes more, or until done.Serve passing extra salsa.

steps.step: Sprinkle generously with salt and pepper.Grill 4 minutes.Turn over.Spoon salsa over fish.Grill 4 minutes more, or until done.
